name: TooltipPositioner
description:
Positions the tooltip against the trigger.
Renders a `<div>` element.

align.description: The align of the tooltip element to the anchor element along its cross axis.

alignOffset.description: The offset of the tooltip element along its align axis.

anchor.type: React.Ref | Element | VirtualElement | (() => Element | VirtualElement | null) | null
anchor.description: The element to which the tooltip element is anchored to.

arrowPadding.description:
Determines the padding between the arrow and the tooltip edges. Useful when the tooltip
element has rounded corners via `border-radius`.

className.description:
CSS class applied to the element, or a function that
returns a class based on the component’s state.

collisionBoundary.description: The boundary that the tooltip element should be constrained to.

collisionPadding.description:
The padding between the tooltip element and the edges of the collision boundary to add
whitespace between them to prevent them from touching.

keepMounted.description: Whether to keep the HTML element in the DOM while the tooltip is hidden.

positionMethod.description: The CSS position strategy for positioning the tooltip element.

render.description:
Allows you to replace the component’s HTML element
with a different tag, or compose it with another component.

Accepts a `ReactElement` or a function that returns the element to render.

side.description: The side of the anchor element that the tooltip element should be placed at.

sideOffset.description: The gap between the anchor element and the tooltip element.

sticky.description:
Whether to allow the tooltip to remain stuck in view while the anchor element is scrolled out
of view.

--available-height.description: The available height between the trigger and the edge of the viewport.

--available-width.description: The available width between the trigger and the edge of the viewport.

--transform-origin.description: The coordinates that this element is anchored to. Used for animations and transitions.
